description.p: Living Wood are sentient plantfolk deliberately created by druidic circles to serve as companions, assistants, and guardians of the natural world. Through ancient rites blending druidic magic with living timber, these beings are grown rather than born—shaped with emotions, cognition, and moral reasoning comparable to humanoids. This design is intentional. Living Wood are not tools, but caretakers meant to act with judgment in both peace and crisis.
They are neither constructs nor mindless plants. Living Wood are alive, aware, and capable of choice—crafted to endure where others pass on.

Most Living Wood adhere to lawful philosophies, reflecting the circles that shaped them: consistency, responsibility, preservation. Their sense of law is rooted not in written codes, but in continuity and duty. Though often calm and patient, Living Wood are not emotionless. They experience attachment, pride, frustration, and grief—tempered by the understanding that nature unfolds across long spans of time.

Many are treated by outsiders as if they were constructs: addressed by their “designations,” evaluated by utility, or assumed to be property. Most circles consider this misunderstanding both common and dangerous. A Living Wood that cannot choose is not a guardian—it is a liability.
All Living Wood are created through ritual, but not all are created from the same timber.
New Wood are formed from younger or more modest trees. They are typically Medium in size—more mobile, more adaptable, and more likely to travel beyond the grove.

Old Wood are created using ancient trees that, over the course of their long lives, have had extensive contact with magic—growing near ley lines, within druidic sanctuaries, or beneath places where the natural and arcane worlds overlap. This accumulated magic does not grant spellcasting; it condenses into density, presence, and endurance. Old Wood emerge Large, slower to move but difficult to displace.
Your Living Wood character has the following racial traits.

Ability Score Increase. Increase one ability score of your choice by 2, and increase a different ability score of your choice by 1.
Creature Type. You are a Plant.
Size. You are Medium or Large (your choice). Medium Living Wood are called New Wood; Large Living Wood are called Old Wood.
Speed. Your walking speed is 30 feet if you are Medium. Your walking speed is 20 feet if you are Large.
Age. Living Wood typically live between 100 and 150 years.
Languages. You can speak, read, and write Common and Druidic.
Skill Proficiency. You gain proficiency in one of the following skills of your choice: Survival, Animal Handling, Nature, or History.
Wooden Frame. While you are not wearing armor, your Armor Class equals 10 + your Constitution modifier. You can still benefit from a shield.
Rooted Awareness. While you are in contact with the ground, you have tremorsense out to a range of 30 feet.
Barkbound Resilience. You have resistance to nonmagical bludgeoning damage.
Bark Harden. When you take bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage, you can use your reaction to reduce the damage by 1d8. You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus per long rest.
Rooted Constitution. You gain a 1d4 bonus to Constitution saving throws.
Grasping Limbs. When you successfully grapple a creature smaller than you, you can choose to restrain it instead. The restrained creature can use its action to attempt to escape, following the normal rules for ending a grapple.
Old Wood Reach. If you are Large, your melee weapon attacks have their reach increased by 5 feet.
